title: What kind of thinker are you?
content:
Take the test;
[url=http://www.bbc.co.uk/science/leonardo/thinker_quiz/]www.bbc.co.uk/science/leo...nker_quiz/[/url]
Let's see..

You are an Existential Thinker

Existential thinkers:
* Like to spend time thinking about philosophical issues such as "What is the meaning of life?"
* Try to see beyond the 'here and now', and understand deeper meanings
* consider moral and ethical implications of problems as well as practical solutions

Like existential thinkers, Leonardo questioned man's role in the universe. Many of his paintings explored the relationship between man and God. Other Existential Thinkers include
The Buddha, Gandhi, Plato, Socrates, Martin Luther King

Careers which suit Existential Thinkers include
Philosopher, Religious leader, Head of state, Artist, WriterYou hear in your mind: GAAARRRRRGG!

title: I'm...
content:
You're an Interpersonal thinker. You:

* Like to think about other people, and try to understand them
* Recognise differences between individuals and appreciate that different people have different perspectives
* Make an effort to cultivate effective relationships with family, friends and colleagues

I'd say that fits me. :-)

title: Re: I'm...
content:
Rather hard to complete for me, since I don't have a job and haven't left school yet. Guess I'll have to wait another 4-5 years or so...
My [url=http://kevan.org/brain.cgi?grafix5000]MindBending Power[/url] is 5.43 points.

content: Neither have I, but I just selected "Didn't complete high school", (which isn't true since I'm in high school (as well, I just use words 'high school' because I don't know any other word for it, school systems are different) I'm not satisfied with the choice of career, and that I wasn't satisfied with education etc.. [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-smile.gif[/img] The rest after that is easy to fill in.You hear in your mind: GAAARRRRRGG!

title: Re: I'm...
content:
[quote]Quote:[hr]Interpersonal thinkers:
Like to think about other people, and try to understand them
Recognise differences between individuals and appreciate that different people have different perspectives
Make an effort to cultivate effective relationships with family, friends and colleagues[hr][/quote]

Yeah, that sounds a bit like me. I'm more of a dreamer. [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-cheeky.gif[/img]

[quote]Quote:[hr]Like interpersonal thinkers, Leonardo had lots of friends and contacts, and was a popular figure at the Italian court.[hr][/quote]

Well... i'm not very popular. Not popular AT ALL. [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-cheeky.gif[/img]

[quote]Quote:[hr]Other Interpersonal thinkers include
Winston Churchill, Mother Teresa, William Shakespeare[hr][/quote]

Well hot dog, you can call me Mother Theresa. Wait... that sounds a little... you know. You can call me Father Theresa! [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-smile.gif[/img]

[quote]Quote:[hr]Careers which suit Interpersonal thinkers include
Politician, Psychologist, Nurse, Counsellor, Teacher[hr][/quote]

[Scoffs] Boring!!! Those are the types of jobs I stand against! I hate psychologists, politicians and teachers!!! Although I wouldn't mind being a psychologist to screw around with people's thoughts and emotions. Muahahahahaa. Otherwise i'd like to be a film director someday. (Short films, music videos etc. That'd be fun!)[img]http://www.geocities.com/miniopolis/soul.txt[/img]

title: Something like that...
content:
[hr]You are a Spatial Thinker

Spatial Thinkers:

* Tend to think in pictures, and can develop good mental models of the physical world.
* Think well in three dimensions
* Have a flair for working with objects

Other Spatial Thinkers include
Pablo Picasso, Michelangelo, Isambard Kingdom Brunel

Careers which suit Spatial Thinkers include
Mechanic, Photographer, Artist, Architect, Engineer, Builder, Set designer.

Like other spatial thinkers, Leonardo had a talent for designing buildings and machinery. He also invented a new style of map making.
[hr]Cave assectatorem Ductoris Alacris

"This is how liberty dies--with thunderous applause." -Padme

title: Re: hah
content:
The problem with these tests is that they are made by psychologists who think in a way, and that way is far from me.

The result fits me only partly:

"You are a Logical-Mathematical Thinker

Logical-Mathematical thinkers:

* Like to understand patterns and relationships between objects or actions
* Try to understand the world in terms of causes and effects
* Are good at thinking critically, and solving problems creatively"

title: Tests...
content:
[hr]Z-1 The problem with these tests is that they are made by psychologists who think in a way, and that way is far from me.
